best_examples.answer: Will vary. As an example - If the load force is equal to the effort force, then the lever(ruler) will be balanced

best_examples.answer: An oil spill on a lake would be easier to clean up as the oil stays in one layer. It would be easier to keep it in one area and to absorb it and retrieve it. It isn’t moving around as much as an oil spill in the ocean
best_examples.rubric: {"criteria": "investigate how scientific knowledge is used by individuals and communities to identify problems, consider responses and make decisions", "total_score": 2, "items": ["I can explain my answer", "I can identify why it would be easier to clean up an oil spill in a lake than one in the ocean", "No evidence"]}
best_examples.question: Why would an oil spill on a lake be easier to clean up than one in the ocean?

best_examples.answer: The best results were when we used two or three mirrors to reflect the light. We also had to make sure that the mirrors were fairly close to the index card

best_examples.question: Identify and explain which method gave the brightest light spot
